            "content": "рдЙрдк┬ж <i>upa,</i> a prefix to verbs and nouns (expressing) towards, near to (opposed to <i>apa,</i> away), by the side of, with, together with, under, down (e. g. <i>upa-</i> <i>gam,</i> to go near, undergo; <i>upa-gamana,</i> approaching. In the Veda the verb has sometimes to be supplied from the context, and sometimes <i>upa</i> is placed after the verb with which it ought to have been compounded, e. g. <i>─Бyayur upa = up─Бyayuс╕е,</i> they approached). <dvsn n='P'/>(As unconnected with verbs and prefixed to nouns <i>upa</i> expresses) direction towards, nearness, contiguity in space, time, number, degree, resemblance, and relationship, but with the idea of subordination and inferiority (e. g. <i>upa-kaniс╣гс╣нhik─Б,</i> the finger next to the little finger; <i>upa-pur─Бс╣Зam,</i> a secondary or subordinate Pur─Бс╣Зa; <i>upa-da┼Ыa,</i> nearly ten); sometimes forming with the nouns to which it is prefixed compound adverbs (e. g. <i>upa-m┼лlam,</i> at the root; <i>upa-p┼лrva-</i> <i>r─Бtram,</i> towards the beginning of night; <i>upa-k┼лpe,</i> near a well), which adverbs lose their adverbial terminations if they are again compounded with nouns (e. g. <i>upak┼лpa-jal─Б┼Ыaya,</i> a reservoir in the neighbourhood of a well). Prefixed to proper names <i>upa</i> may express in classical literature тАШa younger brotherтАЩ (e. g. <i>Upendra,</i> тАШthe younger brother of IndraтАЩ), and in Buddhist literature тАШa son.тАЩ <dvsn n='P'/>(As a separable adverb <i>upa</i> rarely expresses) thereto, further, moreover (e. g. <i>tatra upa brahma yo veda,</i> who further knows the Veda). <dvsn n='P'/>(As a separable preposition with locative) near to, towards, in the direction of, under, below (e. g. <i>upa</i> <i>─Б┼Ы─Бс╕е,</i> towards the regions); near to, at, on, upon; at the time of, upon, up to, in, above (with loc., e. g. <i>upa s─Бnuс╣гu,</i> on the tops of the mountains); with, together with, at the same time with, according to (with inst., e. g. <i>upa dharmabhiс╕е,</i> according to the rules of duty). <dvsn n='P'/>Besides the meanings given above <i>upa</i> is said to imply disease, extinction; ornament; command; reproof; undertaking; giving; killing; diffusing; wish; power; effort; resemblance, &c.; [cf. A particle and prefix to verbs and other words implying, <div n=\"2\"> 1. <lb />Excess, (over, above, &amp;c.;) </div><div n=\"2\"> 2. Likeness, resemblance; </div><div n=\"2\"> 5. Disease, extinction; </div><div n=\"2\"> 6. Orna- <lb />ment; </div><div n=\"2\"> 7. Command; </div><div n=\"2\"> 8. Reproof; </div><div n=\"2\"> 9. Astonishing; </div><div n=\"2\"> 10. <lb />Giving; </div><div n=\"2\"> 11. Killing; </div><div n=\"2\"> 12. Diffusion; </div><div n=\"2\"> 13. Wish, desire; </div><div n=\"2\"> 14. <lb />Effort, exertion, &amp;c. as <s>upakarttuM</s> to assist; <s>upagantuM</s> to approach; <s>upadezwuM</s> <lb />to advice; <s>upalabDuM</s> to revile; <s>upasTAtuM</s> to worship; also <s>upapurARaM</s> an in- <lb />ferior or minor Purana, <s>upakumBaM</s> near the water-pot, <s>upagaNgaM</s> upon the <lb />Ganges, <s>upakAntaM</s> near or with a lover, <s>upAgni</s> in the vicinity of fire.</div></body><tail><L>7270</L><pc>125-a</pc></tail></H1>\n"
